sources.title: Forbidden Jungle
sources.description: An African Jungle adventure with a guy in a gorilla suit; an underweight Tarzan clone; a jungle girl; chimps; a visiting tiger; ethnically confused African natives; and lots of stock footage. Don't ask about the screenplay. Directed by Robert Emmett Tansey. Released in 1950. Complete print.

sources.title: 1950 - Forbidden Jungle - A hunter's mission becomes a wild fight for survival!
sources.description:
Tawa, the vine-swinging 'son of the jungle,' finds his paradise invaded by sweaty hunter Tom and chaos-agent Tamba. When the trees themselves seem to fight back, Tom learns the hard way: in this green kingdom, humans are the endangered species.

Alternative Title: Tawa - The King of the Jungle (1950) 

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/_DuFNTrhOVA


Director: Robert Emmett Tansey
Writer: Frances Kavanaugh
Stars: Don C. Harvey, Forrest Taylor, Alyce Louis, Ray Corrigan

Genres: Jungle Adventure • Action • Drama
Release date: March 2, 1950
Film Location: California

sources.title: Forbidden Jungle (1950) ADVENTURE
sources.description:
Exclusive FRIDAY at PizzaFLIX Edition
Stars: Don C. Harvey, Forrest Taylor, Alyce Louis
Director Robert Tansey

In this Tarzan-inspired tale, a big game hunter is hired to search for the heir to a vast fortune. The missing boy is rumored to be living deep in the African Jungle where no white man has ever returned.

metadata.Plot: Tom Burton, a great-white-hunter and safari leader, is hired to search the African jungle for a long-lost white boy now believed to be living with the wild animals. Eventually, and with many stock-footage adventures, he succeeds in his mission, but realizes it would be cruel to take the boy from the jungle that has now become his home.
metadata.Actors: Don C. Harvey, Forrest Taylor, Alyce Louis
